Assafetida.
ASsafetida, is good to be smelled unto against the suffocation of the mother.
2 Teethach and hollow, fill them with Assafetida. 3 Flowers to cause, stamp it
with a warm pestell, and put thereto Ellebore black or white, and make it a
suppositer and put it in, if this serve not, then use Verdigriece. 4 Fever
quarten, mix it with Rue and Pepper of each two drammes, temper them with
honey, and take as much as a Chestnut two hours before the fit. 5 Matrix
falling after childbirth, lay one ounce on a pan of Charcole, and sit over it
as warm as you can suffer three or four times, and then steep. 6 Taken with a
rere egg to bedward, it opens the liver, and helps shortness of breath:
mother suffocat. apply it to the nauill. 7 The fume thereof taken at the nose
is good for the Lytargie. (See Lacerpitium) for it is of the same operation.

Breathshort 6 Fever quarten 4 Flowers stopped 3 Lytargie 7 Liver stopped 6 Matrix
fallen 5 Suffocat. 1 Teethach and hollow 2
Auens, or herb Benit.
AVens, or her be Benit: Fistula if it be outward put in the juice, if it be
inward drink it. 2 To avoid moles and spots of young children which they have
in their mothers bellies, gather the roots and leaves in March, or May, stamp
them and distill them through a limbeck, and wash therewith often. 3 Fevers,
stamp Auens, Feuerfue, and yarow ana one handful, and strein it with ale, and
drink it two hours before the fit. 4 Bones broken, drink the juice of
Comfety morning and evening three days, ^xfor want thereof Sana^^^da, then
drink Auens, Plantine, and Brusewort morning and evening daily as long as
need is: Yard canker, wash it with the juice of Auens. 5 For all
superfluities gathered about the heart, liver, stomach and sides, stamp Auens
and Feuerfue, and stre^e them with stale ale, and drink it morning and
evening. 6 Speech lost by the palsy, drink Auens, or Baldemonye with warm
water: Fever hot: stamp it with red Wormwood ana one handful, and streine
it with a pint of white wine, and drink it at two or three times. 7 Ache,
seethe Auens and (...) in water, and wash therewith four or five times. 8
Drink the decoction of the root for all inward wounds, griefs of the breast
and sides, and all cruditie, and wash wounds therewith. 9 Ache and gnawing of
the joints, frye it with Sheep sewet and oil, and apply it. 10 Skabs dry,
seethe it with Mouseare ana like much in running water, and wash therewith. 11
Megrim, sees it with Bay leaves ana an handful in a quart of good white wine,
and apply it. 12 The powder thereof drunk with white wine warm, helps much
against the Fevers: it helps wounds and Kankers being drunk. 13 Seethe it in
wine or water, or both, and drink it to dissolve congealed and bruised blood,
and to cure all inward wounds and hurtes, and also wash outward wounds
therewith. 14 Seethe the root in wine and drink it to comfort the stomach, to
cause digestion, to open the liver, and to cleanse and purge the breast from all
gross phlegm. 15 Drink the dried root with wine against poison, and the
collike, and to comfort digestion. 16 The root put into wine gives it a
pleasant taste and smell, refreshes the heart, causes mirth, opens the
liver, helps the stomach that is hurt with cold and gross humors: and the
root sodden in wine cleanses and scoureth wounds, Fistulaes, and Kankers, and
the foul spots of the face being washed therewith, and helps the pain of the
breast and sides. The root must be gathered at the Spring time.

Asarabacca.
ASarabacca: Fever quarten, take one dram of the powder with white wine, one
hour before the fit, to purge it: dropsy, an excellent remedy. 2 Infuse one
ounce in a barrel of sweet wine three months, then streine it, and drink of
the wine morning and evening daily. Fever quarten: hill thee warm in thy bed
an hour before the fit, and drink a glass full of Malmsie or Muscadell with
half a Wall nut shell full of the powder of it, and cover thee well to sweat,
and stamp Sage, Rue, and Bursa pastoris with white vinegar, and apply it to thy
wrists xxiiii. hours, and do so thrice and be whole. 4 Or stamp the green
leaves, and seethe them a little in wine, and drink it two hours before the
fit, and lie on thy belly, it causes vomit, and dissolueth the Fever. 5 The
root boiled in wine, provoke urine and is good for the strangurie, the
cough, shortness of breath, difficulty of breathing, conuulsions, cramps, and
shrunk sinews being drunk. 6 And also is good against venom and venomous
bytings, the dropsy and the Sciatica. Drink it with honyed wine to drive
down the flowers, seconds, and other superfluities of the matrix. 7 The leaves
stamped and streined with wine and drunk, causes to vomit up tough phlegm
and choler. The leaves stamped and applied help the headache, inflammations of
the eyes, breasts that are full of milk to dry it up. 8 The wild fire
especially at the beginning, drink the juice of six leaves with a pint of
Whay especially of Goats milk in the morning in Summer to cast forth yelowe
choler and unnatural phlegm. 9 Steep thirty green leaves in new wine all
night, then streine it, and drink it in the morning to bring forth abundance
of humors from the breast. 10 The wine being powered into a close pot with a
piece of fat porke and sodden, and the porke eaten and the wine drunk, or the
wine may be drunk after the porke, simply diluted or steeped all night with
the leaves and not sodden with the pork but streined and drunk after it. 11 It
helps in this manner the Iaundes, the fever tertian, the beginning of
dropsies, tympanies, 12 Quotidians, Green sickness, Quartens, Worms and
smelling of the stomach, for all which there is no better remedy. 13 The juice
streined with Mill called Misselio and streined with a little Rose Water,
clears the sight. Make powder of the roots with Cinnamom, Sugar, and
Aromatik spices, and take one dram of it to provoke vomit and to purge choler
and phlegm both upward and downward. 14 Sees the root in wine with honey, and
drink it to cleanse the lungs, and for the cough, and shortness of breath. 15
Give the roots to Sheep and great cattle to eat with salt to help them
against their griefs: Use it also sodden in wine with honey for the dropsy,
obstructions of the lungs, 16 Liver, kidneys and bladder, and to cleanse them
and the matrix, and to expel the terms, seconds and dead births both in men
and beasts. 17 Seethe the root in lee, and wash the head therewith to help
the brain and memory.

Baytree.
BAytree, seethe the leaves with Sage in white wine, and drink it with gross
powder of Bays before the fit to help the Fever. Seethe Sage and Bay leaves
ana one ounce in iii. pintes of Ale, with iii. ounces of sugar, and one
spoonefull of pepper to a pint, and streine and drink it before the fit
against the Fever. 2 Sleep to cause, apply powder of Bay berries to thy head.
Gout, boneshaw and swellings, seethe the leaves of Bays and Iuie with oil
Olive, and take out the leaves, and anoint with the oil. 3 Powder of Bays,
Tormentill and Myrrh, ana like much eaten fasting, purges the head, voideth
all humors and raw meats, and suffers no corruption in the body nor
stomach. If a man drink it and brook it not, he shall die: but if he brook
it, he shall live. 4 Ache in the back, kidneis, or limbs, drink powder of
nine Bays morning and evening. 5 For one that is stricken with the Fayrie,
spread oil de Bay on a linen cloth, and lay it above the sore, if it be
beneath the heart, to keep it downward, and none upon the sore, for that will
drive it into every part of the body: but if the sore be above the heart, apply
it beneath the sore, and to the nape of the neck. 6 Face to be white, anoint
with fresh Barrowes grease, the white of an egg, and a little powder of Bays.
Windiness, make powder of Bays and Antes eggs, and use it. Yexing, or
hickit, when it comes of cold, anoint it with oil de Baye warm. 7 Ears
deaf, put in oil de Bay with as much vnguentum Agrippae. Chollike and
stitche, drink powder of Bays and Ginger, and also use it in meats. 8 Fever
shaking, mix powder of Bays Pepper, and Peniroyall, of each one and twenty
grains with scommed honey, and take a spoonefull morning and evening.
Teeth-ache, boil four Bays in wine, and hold thereof in thy mouth. 9 For
griping and wringing in the belly, seethe Bays and Ote branne in wine, and
apply it, also drink the wine. 10 Sickness of the flank, drink three or
four Bays with white Wine, or Ale. For griefs of the lunges, liver, and
milte, drink powder of Bays, Fenigreeke, and Pepper every morning one
spoonefull. 11 Cough and greefes of the breast, boil powder of three Bays
with honey and wine, and drink it when thou go to bed. Skin to be white,
mix Swines grease unsalted with the white of an egg half sodden, beat them
well together with a little powder of Bays, and anoint. 12 Flowers to cause,
drink powder of 36. Bays with wine. Kidneis and reins griefs, stamp the
leaves well, and boil them in wine, til it be thick, and then punne them
again, and apply them. 13 Bladder pain, boil the leaves in water and apply
them. Itch, stamp the roots with salt and bread, and anoint therewith.
Headache, make powder of Bays, half a dram of Scamony, and Saffron one dram,
mix them with vinegar of Roses and anoint therewith. Bowels or guts pain,
seethe the leaves in water and drink it. 14 Plague, drink one spoonefull of
powder of the ripe Beries and some salt with vinegar and water warm in a hot
Fever, but in wine in a cold Fever, and cover thee well to sweat and sleep and
be whole. 15 The Baytree is not stricken with lightning nor evil from heaven.
The branches defend from mothes, worms and corruption both clothes and books.
The Beries taken with wine is good against all poison, venom, and venomous
bitings. 16 The powder of them mixed with honey or some syrup, and often licked
and kept in the mouth, is good for them that wax dry and are in a consumption,
and for difficulty of breathing and ouercharged with phlegm in the breast. 17
The decoction thereof in wine, or the juice thereof dropped into the ears,
helps their deafenes and noise. The Beries are good in medicines to refresh
them that are tired and weary, for cramps and drawings of the the sinews. 18
Moist and dry scuruinesse, being applied with oil or ointments serving to that
use. The oil of Bayberies is of the same virtue, and also serves against
bruses and blew marks. 19 The bark of the root drunk with wine, provoke
urine, breaks the stone, and drives it forth and the gravel also, and
opens the stopping of the liver, milte, and all other stoppings of the inner
parts. 20 Wherefore it is good against the Iaundes that is inueterate and
rooted, the hardness of the milt, the beginning of the dropsy, and to provoke
terms. 21 Plant no Baytree near a Vine. Anoint all cold aches with oil de
Bay, and Aqua vitae. The broth of Bay leaves is good to sit in for the diseases
of the mother and bladder. 22 The green leaves stamped, heal the stingings of
Bees and Wasps. The same with parched Barley and bread, swage all inflammations
and hot burnings. 23 But if they be drunk, they make all that is in the
stomach to go forth by vomit. Bays are good in an electuarie with honey or
sodden with Malmesie against the consumption, shortness of breath, and all
reumes that fall upon the lungs. 24 The bark of the root breaks the stone,
and is perilous for women with child, half a dram thereof drunk with wine is
good for the griefs of the liver. The oil of Bays is good for the head ach,
the Morphue, the singing in the ears, and it causes vomit. 25 The Berry is a
remedy against all poison. The oil de Bay is best that is fresh and bitter and
sharp: it has power to soften and to open the breath holes of the veins, it
drives away weariness. 26 There is no better remedy against the diseases of
the sinews, coldes, falling down of humors, ache in the ears, diseases of
the kidneys that come of cold, then this oil is, if it be laid too, but if
it be drunk, it provoke vomit, it is good also for the ache of the liver,
27 The Megrim that comes of cold cause, the pain of the milt, of the great
gut, and of the mother, and for the scalles and skurfes, worms, scabbes,
wheales, and plookes. 28 The powder of the Berries licked in with honey, or the
pappe of raisins, are good against the consumption, straitness of breath, all
griefs of the breast coming of reume, and for the torments of the belly. The
berries bruised are good against the stingings of Scorpions. 29 The berries
being clean husked, powdered, steeped in wine and drunk, purges women after
their childebirth, and takes away their torments. The juice of the berries
takes away filthy skurfe, and with old wine and Rose oil, it helps the
ache and deafness of the ears. 30 The oil is good for all cold aches, the
Sciatica and cold Agues. Hair falling, anoint with oil de Bay. Ears deaf
and noise, put in the juice of the leaves. Reume, cough, and hoarsenesse, take
up the vapor of Bays in water. 31 Vomiting and lothing, stamp Bays,
Masticke, and Cummin ana one ounce, with the juice of Rue, and apply it to the
stomach with tow. Chollike, Ilyake, and windiness of the stomach, apply Bay
leaves and Cummin to the stomach. 32 Stone to break, use the rynde and Berry.
To cleanse the Matrixe, to void the pain thereof, and to cause conception,
stand over the fume of powder of Bays laid on hot coals, it causes
deliverance. 33 Gout, sees the leaves in water, and mix it with purselaine
water, and wash therewith. Fever quotidian, take two penny weight of the powder
of the berries with a soft egg, or broth before the fit. 34 Heart griefs,
sees Bays in white wine and drink it. To make oil de Bay, grind the leaves
very finely, and temper them with common oil, and heat them over the fire
often: but sees it not, and when it is green, use it. 35 Breast encumbered,
take half a spoonefull of powder of Bays with pottage, or drink to cleanse
and purge downward marueilously. Fevers, use powder of Alysander, Bays, and
Time in brothes. 36 Cough of cold, anoint the chest with oil de Bay. Head
reume, apply powder of Bayberies, and of Penyroyall. Chollike and Iliake,
drink powder of nine or twelve Bays with wine. Eyes griefs, sees Bay leaves
in wine and Foment therewith. 37 Flowers to stop, lay Ginger, Bay leaves, and
Sauin on coals, and receive up the fume thereof through a funnill. 38 Matrixe
fallen out, drink powder of Bay leaves, Hearts horn, and Myrrh ana like much,
with Wine or Ale. Palsy universal, eat oil of Bays with crumbs of bread
hot. 39 Bay: Reins ach, boil the leaves in wine, till they be coagulated,
and apply it by it self, or fried with oil. Ach in the stomach and small
guts: Mix two parts of Bays, and one part of Cummin with Honey, and plaster it
to thy stomach. 40 Head apostume, apply powder of Bays and Cummin to the
head. Flanks griefs general, drink powder of nine leaves morning and
evening. 41 Itch, mix powder of Frankincense, with oil of Bay, and anoint
therewith. To make oil of Bay, stamp the leaves, grind them, and let them
stand two or three days, then sees it and streine it, and that which is
above, is the oil. 42 Sinews shortened, sees a black sheep head with Bay
leaves, Sage, and Camomile stamped, till it be well sodden, then streine it,
and anoint therewith. 43 A green ointment, take Bay leaves, Rue, and Wormwood
ana one pound, Sheep tallow three pound, mix them well, and put thereto
three pintes of Sallet oil, and let it stand two days, then heat it, and
stir it till the herbs be somewhat hard, then streine it and use it.

Oil of Bays, stamp the green Beries, and sees them, and streine it and
use it, or stamp the berries and leaves, and streine it, and keep it in a
glass: or stamp the ripe and fresh Beries, and press out the oil: it is
good against the Iliake, chollike, and Sciatica. Make oil of Iuy Beries in
like sort, which is good in cold causes, especially against cold joint aches.

Aches 4. 21. 30 Back-ache 4. 12. 26. 39. (See stone.) Bellyache 9. 10. 14.
(See chollik.) Bytings venomous 15 Bladder grief 13. 21 Boneshawe 2 Breast
griefs 11. 16. 23. 28. 35 Breath short 16. 23. 28 Bruses 18 Chollik 7. 9. 10.

Barberie.
BArberie: the green leaves are good in meats for sause, as Sorrel to
refresh and cause appetite, and is good for them that be hot and vexed with
the burning Ague. 2 The fruit stop the lask and all superfluous fluxes of
women, and all unnatural flux of blood. The root steeped in lee, makes the
hair yelowe being often washed therewith. 3 The conserve thereof is good
against all fluxes both red and white, it stops the terms and comfort
the stomach and liver, and so does the water of the flowers and leaves
distilled in May. 4 The ripe fruit stamped and applied, breaks and heals
all hot apostumes, and takes away the pain. The root plucketh out pricks.
5 Chollik, take half a glass or less of the juice of the ripe Beries, with
as much powder of red Coral as will lie on two groats, and drink it. 6 Seethe
Barberies in Whay, and drink it for the heat of the liver. To heal an old
flux of the mother, and to scour the matrix, drink the juice of Barberies:
but for that flux and all others, drink the Barberies themselves. Drink the
juice with Rose water to quench thirst. 7 Heart faint, make pottage with
Barberies and Barley meal, and eat them. Stomach chollerik and thirsty, and
to stop the flux, and cause appetite, eat as much as a Wallnut of conserve of
Barberies. 8 Iaundes yelow, seethe as much of the Bark as a Wallnut in a pint
of water bound in a cloth, and cool it, and drink it morning and evening a
good draught, and use also thereof in thy drink. 9 Set a quart of the Beries
on the fire till they be soft, then streine them and put thereto thrice their
weight in Sugar, and seethe it till it be incorporated, and use it.

Appetite 1 Apost. hot 4 Bloody flux 2. 6 Chollik 5 Fever hot 1 Fluxes 2. 6
Heart faint 7 Iaundes 8 Liver hot 6 Matrix flux 6 Pricks 4 Stomach hot 7
Thirst 7 Whites 2. 3. 6
Barley.
BArley: Bake a cake of Barley flower, and vinegar, burn ^t to coals, and rub
the teeth therewith to cleanse them. Mix new Pigeons doung and Barley meal,
with vinegar, and apply it to the Shingles three days, and then renew it if
need be. 2 Boil Barley and Lycoras in water, and use it to help the Fever
and impostumes of the breast and short ribs. The meal mixed with vinegar and
eggs and applied to impostumes, lets them from growing any further. 3 A
plaster of the meal with Turpentine, honey and Lilie roots, softneth and
ripeneth impostumes. For Felons and rancklings, seethe meal of Linseede and
Barley in Ale, and apply it. 4 Headache: Mix Barley meal with Hearts grease,
and the juice of Sorrel, and apply it to the temples. 5 Breast griefs, make
pottage with Barley meal, Baulme, Mynt and water, and use it. Cods swollen,
frye Barley meal with honey, and apply it. Chafing of the flank, or shares:
Anoint with oil of Roses, and the meal of Beans, Fitches, and Barley. 6 To
open a wound that is closed, and too soon whole. Take honey, and the whites of
eggs of each like much, and a little Barley meal, and anoint therewith three or
four times a day. 7 For a swelling, frye Barley meal and powder of Cummin
with honey, and apply it. Seethe Barley with ten times so much water of an
Eastern spring, with a slow fire twelve hours, till it have the color of
Beer, and drink thereof four ounces at once against chollerike heat,
obstructions to move sweat and urine, to cause sleep, to alay thirst, to
nourish, for all griefs of the breast, and for Burning agues, to sweat take
it warm, to lay thirst, take it cold sometimes with Sugar, sometimes without.
8 It helps the heat and redness of the urine and the cough coming of
heat. 9 Cough, make pottage with Barley and butter and eat it: and drink
Barley water with Licoras. 10 To dry up a reume, seethe ashes of Barley chafe
in water, and set thy feet and legs over it, and cover thee well to sweat,
and after wash thy legs and hands up to the knees and elboes, and dry them,
and lie down in thy bed warm, and put a tent of Labdanum into thy nose, etc.
11 Burning or scalding, apply Barley meal with the juice of Purcelaine. 12
Gout, apply Barley meal, with the juice of Nightshade or vinegar. Headache:
apply Barley meal with Frankincense, and the white of an egg two days with a
paper, it helps the Megrim. 13 To make hairs grow where thou will, burn
Barley bread with Salt, and punne it with Barrowes grease, and anoint. 14
Apostumes hot and Feuerous, apply a plaster of Barley meal, Mallows, whites
of eggs, and fresh grease. Nose bleeding, stamp Ribwort, and Housleek with
Barley meal, and apply it about thy neck. 15 Paps with curded milk, apply
Barley meal with vinegar. Emerods, steep crumbs of Barley bread in woman's milk
or Goats milk, with the yolke of an egg and Saffron, and apply it to void
the pain. 16 Headache of choler, drink water sodden with Barley, and hold Sugar
Candy in thy mouth. 17 For griefs of the liver, and the Iaundes, eat the pap
of Barley sodden with water and butter, and drink Barley water to restore the
taste. 18 Liver inflamed, drink Barley water. Belly lose, use pottage of
Barley, and Barley water. Bloody flux, drink Barley water. 19 Loins ach, use
Barley pottage with butter. Loins apostumed, stamp Barley meal three ounces,
Figs two ounces, and the juice of Mallows six ounces, and apply it. 20
Fevers, use Barley water to bedward, and apply as much butter as a bean to thy
nauill. Face swollen, seethe clean Barley into pappe, and apply it hot. 21
Cods and yard swollen, boil Barley meal and Cummin, and apply it. Freckles,
seethe flower of Beans, and Barley in woman's milk, and apply it. 22 Shingles,
apply Barley meal with Doves doung and vinegar. Eyes watring, stamp Camphire
with Barley meal, the yolke of an egg, and a little vinegar, and apply it.
Eyes hurt or bruised, seethe Red Roses in water, and stamp them with Barley
meal, and the yolke of a raw egg, or apply Barley meal with the juice of
Mallows and the yolke of an egg. 23 For the Host: Mix Barley meal and Salt
ana with Butter, and make pellets thereof, as much as half a Wallnut, and eat
two of them in the morning fasting. 24 Breast griefs, seethe Barley meal in
water, and put Fresh butter to it, and eat it often. 25 Breast phlegm: seethe
Isope, fat Figs, Lycoras, and Barley in water, and drink it. 25 For griefs
of the liver, and swelling of the right side, apply a plaster of Barley meal,
vinegar, and the juice of Houseleeke, and Morell, and anoint the side with the
juice of Penyroyall. 27 Cods swollen, melt Sheep sewet in Red wine, and put
thereto Barley meal, and apply it. Fever quarten: on the sick day eat a hot
cake of Barley meal, and drink thereto a good draught of Red wine, before the
sit. 28 And then stamp four Plants of Plantine with their leaves, and streme
them with White wine, and four spoonefuls of cold water, and drink thereof
before the fit take thee. 29 Knees-ach, frye Sheep tallowe with Goats doung,
and Barley meal, and apply it. Apostume to break, apply Barley meal with
honey, and the juice of Smallach or of Wormwood. 30 Use Barley meal in all
medicines for Apostumes and Impostumes. 31 Chollik and Ilyake: apply a plaster
of Barley meal, Wormwood, vinegar and honey. Teeth to be white: rub them with
Barley meal, honey and salt. Legs swollen: Mix the juice of Wallwort with
Wax, vinegar and Barley meal, of each like much, and apply it. 32 Morphue,
use a bath of Barley chafe, and make fine powder of Barley meal, Fenegrek,
and Boras of each like much. Mix it with the juice of an Onyon, and clear
honey, and anoint therewith. 33 Chollik: seethe meal of Linseede, and Barley,
with oil of Camomill, and apply it hot to the nauill. Yard-ach and swelling,
seethe Barley branne with wine and honey, and apply it. 34 Wild fire and
creeping ulcers, and all burnings, frye Barley meal with oil, and apply it.
35 Boil Barley meal, with Figs in honyed water, to dissolve swellings, both
hot and cold, and with Pitch, Rosin, and Pigeons doung, to ripen all hard
swellings, with Tar, oil and wax, and the urine of a child to digest and
rypen the hard swellings of the neck, called Strumae. 36 The same with
Melilot, and the heads of Poppy, swageth the ach of the side, and with
Linseede, Fenegrek and Rue, and it is good to be laid to the pain and
windiness of the belly and guts. 37 Barley given with Myrtles or wine, or
wild tart Pears, or with Brambles, or with the rynde of a Pomegranate,
stops the running of the belly. Plasters made with Barley meal: is good
against the scurfe and leapry. 38 The same mixed with vinegar, or Quinces,
swageth hot inflammations of the Gout. Boiled with vinegar and Pitch, and
applied to the joints, it stays the falling down of reume and humors into
them. 39 The bread thereof does not nourish so well as the bread of Wheat or
Spelt: the greatest and whitest is the best. 40 Take Barley hulled one pound
bruised, seethe it in ten pound of water in a vessel of earth or tin close
stopped to the one half, cool it, and seethe it and drink thereof to quench
hot burning choler in vehement Fevers. 41 You may put to it the seeds of
white Poppy and Letuce, not only to cool, but also to cause sleep. 42 And to
cleanse the lungs, shortness of breath, and hoarsenesse: Put in Figs, Lycoras,
Reasins of the sun, Anniseeds, and a little Isope with Sugar, and seethe all,
and let it stand close covered till it be cold, then streine it and use it. 43
Seethe Barley meal, Linseede, Fenegrek, and the juice of Rue with Malmesey,
and apply it warm to the belly, to void the swelling and pain of the guts.
Seethe the meal with vinegar, to swage the hot burning Gout, and all hot
Inflammations of the body. 44 Seethe the Meal in honey with Rosin, and the juice
of Celandine, to heal old rotten sores. With oil and meal of Fenegrek, to
swage the swelling of the stomach. 45 Temper the meal with honey and Poppy, to
help the swelling heat of the priuities and pain of the side. Seethe Barley
with Fennel, and sup it to increase milk greatly. With Rosen and Doves doung,
it ripeneth all hardness. With Mellilot and Poppy heads, it swageth the pain
of the side. 46 Give Barley half sodden to Hens to make them lay eggs the
oftener and greater. 47 Lie three days and three nights in thy bed covered
with sodden Barley, to cure the Dropsy perfectly, though the belly be greatly
swollen. 48 Seethe Barley, dry Beans, and Lycoras, cut small, of each like
much, in water: and drink thereof first and last five days or more, to
destroy any Impostume, and to cast it out. 49 Mix ashes of burned Barley with
burned Roch Allom and use it to galde Horses backs: and for Fistulaes, and to
eat out dead flesh, but as it shall heal, put in more Barley and less Allom.
50 Burn Barley bread with Salt, and mix it with Bores grease, and anoint what
place thou will, and hairs will grow there. 51 Seethe strong Ale with a
gentle fire till it be thick, and use it to old rotten sores and aches.

Bearefoote, ( See Ellebore.) Basil.
Basil: speech lost, mix the seeds with wine, and drink, and hold thereof
in thy mouth. Short winded, drink half an ounce of the juice, with half a
scruple of Saffron. Swooning, sleep Basil in wine or Rose water, and drink
it. 2 Worms to kill, drink the juice with Gotes milk. Fever quarten,
certian, and quotidian, the stitch, and stopping of the urine, stuff a Hen
with Parsley and Basil, and the substance of a raw egg, and bake her in
paste, and eat thereof daily, and no other meat. 3. Masels and Carbuncles,
fill the places with Basil leaves. The smell of Basil comfort the brain,
but it hurts a weak brain. The seeds are gathered in July. 4 The leaves
sodden and drunk, do take away the swimming of the head, and so does the
herb steeped a night in wine and drunk, The herb sodden in wine, does
cause a pleasant smell, heateth a cold stomach, and helps digestion. 5 The
powder of the herb drunk with the juice of Sloes eight days together,
does help an outward rupture. 5. Seethe the herb in water, and foment the
matrixe therewith, to cleanse it and draw down the terms. To cause
deliverance, and bring down the secondines, drink the juice of Basil. 6
Seethe Basil in wine and oil, and apply it to the fundament to ease the
often desire to go to the stool. 7 Boil it in rain water, and drink it
with a little powder of the juice of Sloes, to help the flixe coming of
cold. Sneesing to cause, put the seeds into the nose. Wartes to rise up by
the roots, mix the seeds with shoomakers black, and apply it. Belly bound
and windy, drink the seeds. 8 Drink the seeds in wine to avoid all
melancholy sadness, and to cause boldness and mirth. 9 Basil helps the
stomach, digesteth hard meats, and is good for the heart and liver. Lungs
inflamed, stamped Basil with Barsey meal and vinegar, and apply it
outwardly. 10 Brain and nose stopped, and to purge and stay reumes, smell to
Basil. Eyes mistie and running, drop in the juice, or eat the herb. Use
dry Basil in thy meats, and wines, and drinks. 11 Seethe it in wine, and
use it against shortness of breathe, the old cough, to expel gross humors,
urine, and terms, morning and evening as Peniroyall. Headache stamp it and
apply it. Use it in sessions for women's griefs, as Peniroyall and Mintes, etc.
12 Seethe it in wine with Spikenard, and drink it against dropsies; winds,
flegmes, coldness of the heart, and hardness of the stomach. Smell to it to
comfort the brain and heart: but the use of it in meats decays the sight.
It is not much to be used inwardly nor outwardly. 13 Drink Basil with vinegar
to void windiness, to stop vomiting, to provoke urine, and for the Dropsy
and Iaundies. 14 Cough old, take it with wine. Eyes pain, stamp it with
wine, and apply it. Eyes dull, and reumatike, and running, drappe in the juice.
15 Swooning and faintness, smell to the herb with vinegar. Frenzy, smell to
the herb to provoke sleep. If thou be hurt with a scorpion, eat Basil
the same day, and it shall not hurt thee. 16 Basil softeneth the belly,
moves the spirits, expels urine, and breeds milk. The seed drunk, is
good for them that are puffed up, with wind, that breed melancholy, and cannot
make water. 17 The seeds or leaves put into the nose, cause sneesing: but when
thou sneesest, shut thine eyes. Eat Basil, and no venomous thing shall hurt
thee that day. 18 To heal a streyning, boil it tender with vinegar and oil,
and anoint or bathe the place therewith. Chollike, seethe it in wine, and apply
it.

Balm.
Drink it in wine against all venomous bitings and stingings, and to comfort
the heart, and expel melancholy and sadness: it is good for all things that
Horehound is good for, but it is much weaker. Be hiues being rubbed therewith,
it keeps the Bees together, and causes other to come to them. 2 The common
Balm is good for the strangling of the mother, being eaten or smelled unto. 3
The juice put into green wounds does glewe and heal them up. 4 Seethe Balm
in white wine, and drink iii. or iiii. mornings together to purge the breast,
to help the shortness of wind, to comfort the heart, to drive away dumpish
heaviness, to help the falling sickness, and all other diseases. 5 To
provoke terms, sit over the fume thereof. 6 Teeth aching, wash with the juice or
broth of it. 7 Use it in glisters against the bloody flixe. 8 Use it with honey
in an Electuarie for the gnawing of the belly and shortness of wind. 9 Apply
it with salt to hard kernels and wennes. 10 It skowreth fores being applied,
and swageth the pains of the joints. 11 Chop it small, and steep it 12.
hours in white wine, and distill it in a glass for the torments of women, the
strangling of the mother, wringing at the heart, etc. iiii. spoonefull at once.
12 Wash the mouth therewith for the ulcers thereof. 13 Drop thereof into the
eyes to clear them. 14 Seethe Balm with Cammomile flowers in a bag, in wine
or water, and press it, and apply it hot to the pains of the matrix, to make
it tarry in the place, and put it in to keep it from falling down. 15 The
water thereof heals all skabs, pushes, and venomous bitings of serpents,
spiders, and mad dogs. Balm steeped in troubled wine, brings it to
clearenesse, and laid upon meat, it keeps it from flies. 16 Nothing does
more comfort the heart, then the decoction thereof, or the water. Burrage water
and fine musk sodden in a clean vessel and drunk when the heart is weak,
it helps the hickit. 17 Stamp it and apply warm to the squincie. 18 Drink
it in wine against vomiting and the Chollike. 19 Stamp it with nuts and honey,
and apply it to clear the sight. It sharpeneth the wits and memory. 20
Distill it against melancholy, with Burrage, Buglosse, and Hysope, and use it.
21 Make Ale or Wine thereof as of Sage, for the griefs of the lungs and chest,
and to cause a good color: but there would be put one ounce of good Licoras
shaven to it. The distilled water serves for the same purposes. 22 Eyes to be
clear, and to avoid fumes from the brain, stamp Balm, and Rosemary ana one
handful, streine them with a quart of Ale, and drink thereof morning and
evening. 23 Sees of each one handful with a quart of milk, as it comes
from the Row, and drink thereof hot morning and evening daily with some of a
grated Nutmeg every day a quart as hot as may be suffered, and anoint with the
ointment of Lauender: it auoideth the causes of headache, and helps the
grief. 24 To preserve from sweat, steep Balm, Rosemary, and Burrage 12.
hours or more in Ale or Beer, and drink thereof morning and evening. 25 For
giddiness of the head, stamp it with oil and apply it: and do the same for
the eyes. 26 For the coming out of the matrix, drink the powder of it with
wine, and for the prefocation, drink the distilled water of it. 27 Urine
dropping, seethe with water-mints in good wine, and drink it, and apply the
herb to thy bladder. 28 For them that have utterly lost their hearing, drop it
into their ears. 29 For the bone-shawe or cold gout at the bone, which
destroys the marrowe, drink the juice of it with half as much Feuerfewe
with stale Ale ix. days, and stamp the leaves of Popler and Feuerfew with
clarified butter and old oil Olive, and apply it six times. 30 Ache, shread
Broom flowers, Balm, and Feuerfewe ana one handful, and sees them in a
little May butter, and keep it, and anoint therewith by the fire, and be
whole. Falling sickness, drink Balm water with Treacle to cure it.

Ache 30 Belly gnawing 8 Bitings venomous 1. 15 Bloody-fluxe 7 Bone-shawe 29
Breast to purge 4 Chest griefs 21 Chollike 18 Color to be good 21 Deafness
28 Eyes to clear 13. 19. 22. 25 Falling sickness 4 Heart to comfort 1. 4. 16

Kernels 9 Matrixe pains 14. 26 Melancholy 1. 4. 20 Mother 2 Mouth ulcers 12
Skabbe 15 Sores 10 Squincie 17 Sweat to preserve from 24 Teeth-ache 6 Terms
to provoke 5 Vomiting to stop 18 Urine dropping 27 Wenne 9 Wind short 4. 8
Wit to sharpen 19 Women's torments 11 Wounds green 3
Beans.
Beans, put the flowers into a close glass in the hot Sun, and it will
turn to an oil, good for the saulsflegme. 2 Ranker, apply Bean meal with
yolks of eggs. Felon ache, seethe Beans till they be tender, and grind them
to apply them. 3 Sinowes rankling and swelling, seethe Bean meal long in
white wine till it be thick, and put thereto some honey, and apply it till it
be whole. 4 Wounds to heal, mix red Coleworts, Garlike, Bean flower, the
white of an egg, and fair grease, and heat it, and apply it. 5 Paps ache,
and all other ache, apply Bean meal with yolks of eggs. 6 Stone, stamp young
green Beans as small as Peason, and distill them, and drink the water. 7
Cods swollen, seethe Bean meal with honey and Cummin, and apply it. 8 Face or
skin to be white, do off the husks of Beans and steep them in vinegar or
wine 24. hours, then dry them in the sun, and mix their powder with a
Lilly root, and temper them with water luke warm, and wash therewith to be
ward to void al slime and spots. 9 Chollike, drink the distilled water of
Bean cods, iii. or iiii. times. 10 Skin to cleanse, wash with Bean flower and
water. 11 Whites to stop, sees it in the milk of a Cow to pap, and put
thereto clarified honey, cloves, mace, and saffron, and eat thereof warm as
often as need is. 12 Bloody Flux, boil powder of parched Beans in ale with
sugar, and drink it as hot as may be suffered. 13 Hair not to grow, mix the
bran of Beans with a childs urine, and anoint. 14 Swellings, sees Bean
flower in vinegar, till it be thick, and apply it hot. 15 Stomach hot, mix
the meal of Beans and Lynseede, with the white of an egg, and apply it cold
to the stomach. 16 Hairs to void, use Bean meal in stead of soap daily. 17
Coughs, use meal of parched Beans. Fundament fig, make powder of Beans,
Geniper berries, and Pepper, of each like much, and drink it morning and
evening. 18 Apost. to ripen, apply Bean meal with honey upon unwashed wool. 19
Emerods, sit over the smoke of Bean straw ashes. 20 Cods swollen, apply Bean
meal with vinegar cold, or stamp green Beans with honey, and apply them
cold. 21 Eyes bruised, apply Bean meal with woman's milk. Skull broken, take
ye seeds of Pla^ten iii. ounces, of sharp leaued Dock iiii. ounces, meal of
black Beans, as much as you will, stamp them well, and seethe them in very
strong wine, and apply thereof morning and evening. 22 Cold apost. of the
cods, apply Bean meal with ye pulp of raisins, honey and powder of Cummin.
Distill the flowers before they be yellowe, in Balneo Mariae, and drop
thereof into the eyes that are red and dropping at night. 23 Breath stinking of
Garlike, eat raw Beans. 24 Hair not to grow, seethe them in water, and
wash daily therewith, or stamp ye husks or skins of green Beans, and apply
it. 25 Flux, seethe green Beans, pods and all in water and vinegar, and eat
them al. 26 Skin to be fair, wash with water of the blossoms. Flux to stop,
dry Beans over the fire, and sees good store of the flower of them with a
quarte of Ale, and eat thereof hot at night. 27 Hair not to grow, apply
Bean flower. Head giddie, and dasling of the eyes, bruise hulled Beans with
the white of an Egg, and apply it. Nose bleeding, put in powder of hulled
Beans. 28 Flux, sees Beans in vinegar, and eat them, or apply them to the
nauel. 29 Cods swollen, apply Bean flower with the juice of Wallwort and common
oil. 30 Lust to abate, and to prevent the growing of hairs in boys genitors,
apply Bean meal. 31 Breast swollen, apply Bean meal with whites of Eggs.
32 Gout with swelling, mix iiii. ounces of Bean flower with the yolks of
Eggs, and apply it. 33 Glandules, kernels, and scrophules, bake Bean flower
with the juice of Coriander, and apply it. 34 Beans green and unripe eaten,
do loose the belly, and therefore are to be eaten with Cummin. Dry Beans
bind the belly, especially eaten with their husks, and nourish but little. 35
The meal applied, dissolueth all swellings and tumors, and is good for the
vlcerations and inflammations of the paps and genitors sodden with wine. 36
Bloody-fluxe sees Beans with their husks in water and vinegar, and eat
them, it stays all fluxes and vomiting. 37 The flower by it self or with
Barley meal applied, swageth inflammations and bruses and their marks. With
meal of Fenigreeke and honey, it takes away the swelling of the paps with
curded milk, and the inflammation thereof, and swellings, impostumes, and
swellings behind the ears. 38 But with Roses, Frankincence, and the white of
an egg, the eyes that fall outward, and swellings, both windy and others. 39
The same knodden with wine, helps pearls and stripes of the eyes. Beans
chewed without any husk, and applied to the forehead, stops the humors that
fall into it. 40 Half a Bean without ye husk, stops bleeding that comes
by the sucking of a Horseleech, being applied to the place. 41 Beans sodden in
water, and applied with swines grease, eases the gout. 42 The leaves are good
for the brusing and wounds of the sinowes, especially the meal sodden with
honey and vinegar. 43 With Fenigreeke and honey it heals felons and pusshes. 44
With white Frankincense, the white of an egg, and Rose Water, sore swelled and
dropping eyes. 45 With oil and vinegar applied hot, it swageth swollen cods.
46 Strained twenty times with cold milk, it cleanses the face being washed
therewith at night and in the morning with cold water and milk, and so it
keeps it from sun burning, taking withal one dram of Aloes put into two or
three raisins to open the liver, and to withstand flushings into the face.

Aches 5 (see gout) Apost. 18. 22. 37 Belly bound 34 Black spots 37 Blood to
stop 40 Bloody-fluxe 12. 36 Breasts ache 5 swollen 31. 35. 37 Breath stink 23
Bruses 37 (see eyes) Chollike 9 Cods swollen 7. 20. 22. 39. 35. 45 Cough 17 Eyes

Whites 11 Wounds 4
Beeche.
BEeche, the leaves are very good to be laid to the beginning of hot
swellings, blisters, and ulcers. 2 The water found in the hollownesse of
Beeche, does cure noughty skurfe and wild tetters or skabs of man or beast, of
horses, kine, or sheep being washed therewith. 3 The nuts are sweet and good
to eat, and do serve for almost all purposes ye Pineapple kernels do serve
for. 4 The leaves chewed are good for the diseases of the goms and lips. 5 The
nuts burned and mixed with honey, is good for a skalde and skuruie head when the
hair goes off being laid to. 6 The same is good for the stone. 7 The leaves,
bark, buds or cups, sodden in red wine or running water, and sitten over
stops the terms, and puts back the matrix and fundament that are
fallen: and the decoction thereof in clean red wine with Cinnamon and Sugar, is
good to the same effect.

Blisters 1 Byles 1 Fundament fallen 6 Flowers to stop 7 Gomes griefs 4 Head
clean. 5 skales and skurf 5 Hair falling 5 Lips griefs 4 Matrix fallen 7
Skurfe 5 Stone 7 Swellings hot 1 Ulcers 1
Beetes.
BEetes, the juice put into the nose cleanses the head, it swageth the ache of
the eyes, it cleanses the head from lyce and nits, and restores hair, it
destroys byles and botches. 2 The overmuch use of it nourishes evil humors
in the body. 3 Sees white Beetes in water, and wash running sores therewith.
Put the juice of the root into the nose to purge the head. 4 Roste the root
in the embers and eat it, to take away the smell of Garlike, Onions, or
Leekes. 5 If one have drunk a Horseleeche or Bloodsucker, let them drink the
juice of Beetes, with some brine and vinegar to kill it. 6 Head ache, megrem,
and swimming, put the juice of the bark of the root into the nose: and for
the tooth ache, put it into the nosestrell on the same side that the ache is on
bloodwarme by it self, with cowes milk or woman's milk. It causes sneesing,
and so is good for the Iaundies. 7 Belly bound, struck a little salt on a
Beete root, and put it into the fundament, and so to avoid head ache that
comes of costiuenesse. 8 Head ache of murre or reume, put the juice of a
green root with a tent into the nose, the white foam being scommed off.
Beetes engender good blood. 9 The white Beete purges and cleanses all evil
humors. 10 Seethe white Beetes in water and wash the head therewith, to void
the dandruf and skales. 11 Use the herb but little inwardly, especially raw,
because it breeds evil humors. 12 Seethe it with mustardseede to help
griefs of the milte. 13 Apply the juice of it to the holy fire. Put iii. or
iiii. drops of the sodden root into the ears to void their pain. 14 Take
the juice with the seeds of Cummin, or Dill, to void the gripings of the
belly. 15 Draw up the juice with oil of bitter Almonds into the nose, to
purge the head. 16 Rub the juice on the gums to cease the raging pain of the
teeth. 17 The young plants eaten with vinegar, provoke appetite, slake thirst,
and repress choler in the stomach. 18 The ashes of the root with honey,
restores hair, and keeps the rest from falling. 19 The root of Black or
red Beetes put into the nose, being first bruised, cleanses the brain. 20 The
broth of the root and leaves skowreth away skurfe, skales and nits of the
head, and swageth the pain of kibed heels, and it helps frecles and spots,
if they be first rubbed over with salt peter natural, and so it helps the
falling of the hair, it helps running sores which spread abroad and waste
up the flesh as they go. 21 Sodden in water it helps the bursting out of
wheales, burnings, inflammations, and such like. Drink the juice of white
Beetes to cleanse the stomach, put the juice with honey into the nose to cleanse
the brain, and to help the head ache, and into the ears to void their pain
and noise. 22 Stamp the leaves and apply them to spreading sores, skales and
skurfe. Eat white Beetes with vinegar and musterd, to help the obstructions
of the liver and miste.

Appetite 17 Apostume 1 Bellybou^d 7. 9. 21 griping 14 Brain (See head) Biles
1 Breath stinking 4 Burnings 21 Choler 17. 21 Ears ache 13. 21. noise 21 Eyes
ache 1 Face deformed 20 frecles 20 Head ach 1. 6. 7. 8. 21 clensing 13. 15. 19.
21. megrem 6 skales 10. 20. 22. skurfe 10. 20. 22. swimming 6 Hair falling 1.
18. 20 Holy fire 13 Iaundies 6 Inflammation 21 Kibes 20 Lice 1 Liver stopped 22
Milte stopped 22 Nittes 1 Obstructions 22 Purgation 9. 21 Pusshes 21 Reume 6
Sneesing to cause 6 Sores spreading 20. 22 Stomach griefs 17. 21 Teeth ache 6.
16 Thirst 17 Wheales 21
Bengewin.
BEngewin, or Lacerpitium, stop it in a glass, and set it into a dounghill
fifteen or twenty days, and then streyne it, and use it as a singular and
dayntie oil. 2 Toes stink, and face chops, rub the place with the powder of
it or of Myrrh. 3 Dissolve it in water, and drink it to cure the hoarcenesse
that comes suddenly. 4 Suppe it with a rere Egg to cure the Cough. 5 Take it
with some broth against an old plurisie. It cures the Iaundies and dropsy
taken with figs. 6 It is good against crampes and shrinking of the sinowes
and other members one scruple being taken. 7 With Pepper and Myrrh it
expels the terms, seconds, and dead birth. 8 And taken with honey and
vinegar, or with syrupus Acetosus, it is singular against the falling
sickness. 9 Taken with the kernels of raisins, it helps the flixe that
comes of weakness of the stomach called Celiacus morbus. 10 Being drunk
with Wine, Pepper, and Frankincence, it drives away the shakings of Agues. 11
Make thereof an Electuarie with Pepper, Ginger, and the leaves of Rue with
Honey. It is a singular medicine against the Fever quarten. It is called
Antidotum ex succo Syreniaco. It is good against all venomous bitings and
poisoned darts and weapons to be taken inwardly, and also applied to the
wounds. 12 It is very good against all wounds and bitings of dogs, mad
beasts, and serpents and stingings. 13 Being straked on the eyes with Honey, it
quickens the sight, and takes away hawes and webbes in the eyes at their
first coming. 14 Being put into aching, hollow, and corrupt teeth, it takes
away their pains, and so it does being sodden with Figs and Hysope in
water, and holden in the mouth. 15 Apply it with honey to stay the falling of
the Vuula. 16 Gargle it with Hydromel or Meade, to cure the Squincie. 17 Gargle
it with vinegar, and keep it in the mouth, to make the Horseleeches to come
out of the wesand or throat. 18 Apply it with Rue, Niter, and Honey, to break
the pestilentiall Apostumes and Carbuncles 19 And likewise to Corns or
agnailes, being first scarifyed with a knife to take them away. 20 Apply it
with Coprose, and Verdigreece to all superfluous outgrowings of flesh, and the
polyp in the nose, and all skuruie manginesse. 21 Apply it with vinegar,
pepper, and wine, to cure the noughtie skurffe of the head and falling of the
hair. 22 Boil it in vinegar with the pill of a Pomegranate, to take away all
outgrowings of the fundament. 23 Boil it in oil, and anoint kibed heels
therewith, being long bathed first with wine. 24 With vinegar, it heals foul
skurfe of the skin. Use to eat thereof to have a good and fresh color: with
a soft egg it helps the cough. 25 Take half a scruple for the bowing back
of the head, drink it with vinegar against clodded milk in the breasts: with
Oximel for the falling sickness. 26 It is melted with bitter Almonds, or Rue,
or hot bread, to make drinks of it. Magistrantia may be used for it. To make
the oil of it see Almonds.

Agnailes 19 Bitings venomous 11 12 Breasts sore 25 Carbuncles 18 Chaps 2
Corns 19 Cough 4. 2 Crampe 6 Color bad 24 Dead birth 7 Dropsy 5 Eyes griefs
13 Falling evil 8. 25 Feet stink 2 Fevers cold 10 quarten 11 Flesh
superfluous 20 Fluxes 9 Flowers stopped 7 Fundament griefs 22 Head bowing 25
skurfe 21 Hair falling 21 Horcenesse 3 Horse-leeche 17 Iaundies 5 Kibes 23 Mad
dog 12 Mandge 20 Nose polip 20 Plague sore 18 Plurifie 5 Poison 11 Polip 20
Seconds 7 Sinowes 6 Skin grief 20. 24 Skurfe 20. 24 Squincie 16 Stomach
weak 9 Teeth-ache 14 Throat griefs 17 Venom 11 Vuala fallen 15 Wounds 11
Betony.
BEtony, ache or gout, put a spoonefull of honey with ix. corns of Pepper into
an egg shell full of the juice of Betony, and drink it with a draught of
wine. 2 To be delivered of a dead child, drink the juice of Betony and Nep
with Ale. 3 Eyes dull, put in the juice of Betony to stop the tears, and
drink Betony three days after with hot water. 4 Stamp Betony, and apply it to
the forehead of them that are frantik, or possessed with devils: proved. 5 For
all goutes and headache, sees Betony well, and drink the broth, and apply the
rest to the place. 6 Headache, sees Betony, Veruin and Wormwood in water,
and wash therewith, and grind the same herbs with some of the water and
wheat branne, and apply it hot to the molde of the head thrice and be whole:
proved. 7 For the head ache and broken bones, drink the juice, and apply the
dross to the place, to draw out the bones, and heal the wound. 8 Head megrim,
sees Betony, Veruin, Horehound, and Hysope in white wine, and wash the head
therewith, and apply the herbs as hot as may be suffered. 9 Head ache of
cold phlegm, seethe Betony in wine with a third part of water, and apply it.
10 Head noise, pain and turning, drink powder of the leaves dried in the
shade, or rather eat it with slices of bread steeped in wine first and last to
restore the brain. 11 Sleep to cause, apply Betony to the head. 12 Vomit to
stop, make a confection of powder of Betony one ounce, and honey iiii. ounces,
and take thereof every morning fasting. 13 Brain to restore, use powder of it
in thy pottage. Head ache, make lee of Betony, and wash the head therewith
thrice a week. 14 Ears ache, put in the juice with oil of Roses. 15 Ears
deaf, put in the juice of Betony and Horehound. 16 Eyes smarting, wash them
with the juice of Betony, and white wine. 17 Nose bleeding, put in powder of
Betony, with as much salt as can be taken up with iii. fingers. 18 Teeth ache,
seethe Betony and wild Gourdes in wine or vinegar, and hold it hot in thy
mouth. 19 Palsy and loss of speech, drink iii. drams of Betony with Goats
milk iii. days. 20 For vomiting, stopping of the breast, and shortness of
breath, drink one dram and a half of powder of Betony, with a goblet full of
water fasting. 21 Stomach gnawing, use Betony and Wormwood with warm water
and sugar. 22 Spitting blood, drink the juice with Goats milk, or use the
powder witholde wine. 23 Breast to cleanse, and to purge phlegm, drink the
powder with warm water. 24 Milt griefs, sees it in wine, and drink it.
Back or reins greefes, drink it as before for head ache, 25 Bladder pain,
seethe the root of Smallage in water, and drink it with powder of Betony. 26
To cause deliverance speedely, drink powder of Betony. 27 Mad dogs biting,
stamp green Betony and apply it. 28 Fistula, stamp it with salt, and put it
in, and apply the herb. 29 Treacle for the mother and all poison, take powder
of Betony one ounce, of Centory iiii. ounces, of Rue ii. ounces, mix them with
clarified honey, and keep it, and use it. 30 Blood to stop, stamp it with salt
and put it in. 31 Emerods, drink the juice of Yarow, Betony, and Mouseare
often. 32 Flowers to cause, drink the juice with good ale. 33 Head ache, mix
the juice of Betony, Mints, and smallage, with as much vinegar, and put thereof
into the ear, and apply the dross thereon, proved: or stamp Camomile and
Betony, and seethe them in sour ale, and apply it hot: or drink powder of
Betony with fair running water, sugar, and nutmegs, proved. 34 Back ache,
stamp Betony, Egrimony, and Mugwort, of each like much with Galts grease and
vinegar, and apply it. 35 Eyes web, drink it with water 9. days. 36 Eyes
bleared, and sore, put in the juice. Mouth bleeding, drink powder of Betony
and Peniroyall iii. days. 38 Teeth worms, seethe Betony in wine or vinegar,
and hold thereof hot in thy mouth. 39 Heart Cardiak, mix the juice with
Treacle and powder of Cloves, Cummin, and Annise, and use it 9. days. 40 Venom
or poison, seethe powder of Betony with red wine, and drink it. 41 Wounds and
bruses, stamp it with stale Ale and swines grease, and apply it. It draws
out broken bones and heals well after. 42 Head ache, seethe iii. handful of
Betony in a pottell of wine to a pint, and wash the head therewith, and apply
the herb. 43 Eyes tears, seethe Betony and Fenell roots, and wash
therewith. 44 Eyes stripes, stamp Betony and apply it. 45 Eyes dim and
blemishes, seethe Betony, or the root thereof, and wash therewith. 46 Eyes
cloudy and blind, drink one dram of Betony with water. Eyes watery, eat
Betony. 47 Eyes cloudy, stamp Rue and the flowers of Betony, and streine them
with morning dew, and put it in. 48 Ears pain, deaf, and other impediments,
put in the juice of Betony warm. 49 To help digestion and withstand vomiting,
use Betony with honey. 50 Reumes, ache, and to expel the stone of the reins
and bladder, drink Betony with Wine, Honey, and Pepper. 51 Yard pain and
swelling, seethe Betony in wine, and apply it. 52 To cause deliverance without
peril, seethe Betony in wine, and take one dram, and look there be no pears
in the house, for they are hurtful, and suffer not the matrix easily to open.
53 Gout pain, seethe Betony, and drink it and also apply it. 54 Fever
quotitian, stamp Betony two drams, Planten one dram, streine them, and drink
it before the fit. 55 Fever quarten, take iiii. drams of Betony, with wine,
water, and honey, before the fit. 56 Fistula, stamp Betony and apply it. 57
Glandules, scrophules, and kernels, stamp the root with doves doung, and
grease, and apply it. 58 Bones broken, apply Betony to draw them out. 59 Eyes
bruised, stamp it and apply it. 60 Eyes dim, or blemish, sees it in water,
and wash therewith. 61 Eyes bloody and cloudy, drink one dram of the powder
with the water thereof. 62 Eyes tears, eat Betony. 63 Gout, drink a little
dishfull of the juice every of the 9. first mornings of May. 64 Back ache
stamp Betony, Egrimony, and Mugwort, and their roots with old grease and
vinegar or vergis, and apply it iii. days. 65 Surfeit, stamp it and drink it
with a little hot water and wine morning and evening iii. days. 66 Poison
drunk, sees one dram of the powder in wine a little, and drink it to have
present help: and drink fasting to withstand poison. 67 Serpents being in a
circle of Betony, cannot go out of it, but rather will dye with beating
themselves. 68 Eyes stroke, stamp it and apply it, and drink the juice with
small drink or water, and wash the eye with water wherein it, or the root
thereof has been sodden. 69 Eyes running, stamp it with the white of an
egg, and apply it with flax hurds. 70 Phlegm in the stomach to break it and
purge it abundantly, use the power of it in pottage, and drink the juice of
Sorell. 71 Headache apply Betony water with a cloth from ear to ear. 72
Betony has like virtues to Balm, it breaks wind, comfort a weak
stomach, either the flower or herb boiled, or the distilled water, or powder
of the herb by it self, or with honey: it helps the mother. 73 The leaf,
flower, or root in drink, conserve, electuarie, syrup, or potion, or powder,
is singular for all diseases of the stomach, liver, milt, kidneis, bladder, the
obstruction of the matrix, and the moisture thereof, the consumption of the
lungs, coughes, dropsies, continual Fevers, boil the leaves and flowers in
honied water to have present remedy. 74 Teeth ache, seethe it with Sage and
alom in vinegar, and apply it. 75 Urine to cause speedily, take half a
spoonefull of the roots and leaves in powder, with white wine, possit ale,
broth or drink. Ptisik, seethe the powder with honey to an Electuarie, and use
it. 76 Barrenness by too much fatness, drink one dram of the powder, with
one ounce of the water. 77 Eye bruise, stamp the leaves either sodden or raw,
and apply them. 78 To cause a pellet or shot to come out of the flesh: stamp it
with the fat of a Hare into an ointment, and apply it. 79 Nosebleeding, stamp
it with salt, and put it in, and anoint the forehead with vinegar. 80 Spetting
blood, drink the roots with Goats milk three days, or boil Betony, Rue,
Smallach, and Mints in Goats milk, and sup it warm. 81 To expel evil
humors which annoy the eyes, drink Betony with warm water ix. days. 82 Head
broken, stamp it and apply it with Swines grease. 83 To purge a costiue body
gently, seethe Betony, Sothernwood, and Penyroyall ana one handful to the
third part, and drink thereof. 84 Eyes to be clear, eat Betony fasting. 85
Flanks swollen, drink the juice or powder of Betony. 86 Headache, seethe it
with Cammomill and Fenell in water, and wash the head therewith. 87 Ptisik and
spetting blood, seethe it with Horehound, Nep, and xx. corns of Pepper in wine,
and drink thereof daily with Pyment nine days, and the tenth day drink a cup
full of the juice of Betony with common oil. 88 Reins ache, drink an
egshelfull of the juice of Betony, with as much wine and ix. corns of Pepper
ix. days. 89 Ears deaf, put in the juice with Rose water. 90 Fever
quotidian, drink Betony and Planten, of each two ounces, with water warm. 91
Head broken, and to draw out bones, stamp Betony, Veruin, and Rue, with honey or
Rye meal, or Wheat flower, and the white of an egg, and apply it. 92 To
expel a dead child, drink Betony and Rue, and Isope with warm water. 93 For
all manner of sicknesses, drink the juice of Betony every morning of May a good
draught to be free from all sicknesses, but death for one year. 94 Gout to
prevent, drink half a pint of the juice yearly in the beginning of May. 95
Ears dull, put in the juice with as much oil of Spike. 96 Headache, stamp
Betony, and apply it to the temples. Headmegrim, drink Sage royal, Betony and
Wormwood with vinegar xxx. days. 97 Phlegm to avoid, make little pellets of
the powder with honey, and swallowe them down whole when thou go to bed. 98
Spetting blood, seethe Betony, Mints, Smallach, and Rue in milk, and drink it
first and last. 99 Eyes ache, apply the water or juice of Betony, and also
drink it. 100 Eyes web, stamp it and streine it with wine or water, and drink
it x. days to destroy it. 101 Teethach, stamp it and seethe it with vinegar to
the one half, and hold thereof often it thy mouth. 102 Cough, mix the juice or
powder with honey and make it an electuary, and use it ix. days. 103 Yard sore
and swollen, stamp it with white wine, and apply it. 104 Gout, seethe it in
water and drink it, and also wash ye feet therewith, and apply the herb. 105
Drunkenness to withstand, drink the herb or powder in the morning to be free
that day. 106 For the plague if one be infected, drink the water of Betony,
and Scabious, of each like much, with a good quantity of Treacle of
Andromachus, or for want thereof common Treacle, and drink thereof often to
expel the poison from ye principal parts, and to save life. 107 Headache stamp
Betony, Veruin, and Cummin, and apply it, or drink Betony fasting daily, or
drink Betony with water x. days, or take Betony, Cammomill and powder of
Nutmegs ana like much, if ye stomak be stopped, put thereto one ounce of Seen,
seethe them in Ale, and take thereof half a spoonefull morning and evening
warm, or drink the juice of Betony, wine, and honey of each one spoonefull with
nine corns of Pepper four days. 108 Speech lost, drink the root of Betony,
or bear it about thee. 109 Bruses of all sorts, seethe Betony, Auens, and
Cammomill of each like much in stale, and apply it, and he whole. Head broken,
drink the juice of Betony to cast out the broken bones. 110 Bytings of mad
Dogs, or Adders, drink Dragons, Rue, and Betony. 111 Worms, drink powder of
Betony. 112 Biting of an Adder, seethe Rue, Betony, and Fenell in Butter, and
drink it. 113 Belly bound, stamp the root of Betony and drink it with Ale,
it purges well. 114 Speaking in sleep, take Betony about thee when thou go
to bed. 115 Teethach, drink the root of Betony, or bear it about thee. 116
Deliverance to cause speedily, drink Betony. 117 Color to be clean, drink
water of Betony. 118 The decoction of Betony drunk, provoke urine, breaks
the stone of the kidneys, cleanses and scoureth the breast and lungs, and is
good for the Ptisik or consumption, and the cough. 119 Drink one dram of
powder of the leaves with Hydromell for the cramp, and diseases of the mother,
and to provoke terms. 120 Drink the dried leaves in Wine against venomous
bytings and inward poison, and apply the herb to the place: And taken
beforehand, it preserves from poison. 121 Betony opens the stopping of the
liver, milte, and kidneys, and cures the same, and is good for the dropsy.
122 Drink it with wine and water against spetting of blood. 123 It cures all
wounds both inward and outward, it comfort the stomach, helps digestion,
voydeth belching and the desire to vomit, being taken with clarified honey after
supper, and so does conserve made thereof with Sugar, as much as a Bean at
once. 124 The powder of the root taken with honyed water, provoke vomit, and
to cast out tough phlegm and superfluous humors. 125 Drink Betony with
Hydromell to losen the belly gently, and to help the falling sickness,
madness and headache. 126 Betony has like virtues of Balm, it breaks wind,
comfort the weak stomach, either the herb or flower boiled, or the water
or powder works all these effects, and is good to be used either alone or
with honey, it is good for women that are troubled with the mother. 127 The
leaf, flower, and root sodden and drunk, or used any other ways, is
singular for all diseases of the stomach, liver, milte, kidneys and bladder, it
freeth the Matrix from all obstruction, and draws from thence all superfluous
moystnesse. Boil the leaves and flowers in honyed water to help the
consumption of the lungs, coughs, dropsies, and consuming Fevers coming from
the stomak. 129 Dry the leaves and roots in an oven wherein brown bread has
been baked, and use half a spoonful of the powder in white wine, possit ale,
drink, or pottage to provoke urine speedily. 130 Drink Betony fasting, and no
poison shall hurt thee. 131 Seethe one spoonefull of the powder in a draught of
white wine, and drink it after the drinking of poison to help thee. 132 Seethe
Betony in water, and wash the eyes therewith, for any dimnesse or other
blemish. 133 Eyes cloudy and bloody, drink Betony water, with one dram of the
powder of it. 134 Use Betony, and the flowers thereof any ways against the
belching and weakness of ye stomak, the strangling of the mother, all griefs of
the stomak, liver, milt, kidneis, bladder, and Matrix, the Iaundes, the Ptisik,
sighing, griefs of the lungs, the disposition to the dropsy, the rotten and
continual Fevers which begin in the stomach, especially the leaves and flowers
sodden in water, and drunk with honey warm, and so it helps also them that
be mad, the falling sickness, the Sciatica, and the palsy. 135 Bytings
venomous, seethe the leaves with Red wine, and apply them. 136 Bursten places,
apply the leaves. 137 Mother strangled, drink one dram with water and honey.
138 Serpents biting, drink iii. drammes, with xviii. ounces of wine. 139 Drink
one dram with wine against deadly poison. 140 Apply the herb to venomous
bytings. 141 Drink one dram with vinegar and honey, against the griefs of the
liver and milte. 142 Take as much as a Bean with sodden honey after supper to
help digestion, and to avoid sower belching, and stinking of breath. 143
Drink half a dram with two ounces of cold wine for spetting of blood. 144
Drink it with water against the Sciatica and ache of the kidneys and bladder.
145 Drink two drams with water and honey against the dropsy in an Ague, but
without an Ague with wine and honey. Drink four drammes with honyed water to
purge the body. 146 Use it with honey against the Ptisik, and spetting of matter
and corruption from the lungs. Keep the leaves dried in an earthen pot. 147
Wine and vinegar made with Betony, are good for the stomach, and to clear the
eyes. 148 Seethe it and Wormwood in White wine to purge phlegm: it kills
Worms. 149 A precious and most noble balm. Take oil Olive one pint. S.
Iohnswort, Betony, Centory, and Selfeheale, of each one handful, stamp them
and mix them well, and let it distill in a glass all the Summer, then press
it out: it cures all wounds by only anointing them morning and evening: it
expels humors, and is wonderful in fractures and bruses, and all such like.

Birch.
BIrch: Put powder of Birch coals into any wound or great sore to heal it
perfectly. 2 Skotch the body of the tree after the Spring time, and gather the
water, and drink it for the stone in the reins. 3 The same juice is good for
the Iaundes. Some use to distill the juice and to use it against many foul
griefs of the skin, and exulcerations of the mouth, wheales, and pusshes and
such like, and likewise the distilled water of the leaves. But lee made with
the ashes of the Bark thereof is more effectual for the griefs aforesaid.
4 The juice of the leaves is good to be kept for cheeslop to save the cheese
from breeding of worms in it.

Iche 3 Mouth sores 3 Pusshes 3 Skin griefs 3 Sores 1 Stone 2 Wounds 1
Wheales 3
Bistort.
BIstort, the root boiled in wine or water and drunk, stops the bloody
flux, the flowers, and all issues of blood, and the desire to vomit, and so
does the powder drunk with Red wine. 2 The decoction of the leaves is good
against all sores and inflammations of the mouth and throat, and fasteneth lose
teeth being holden often in the mouth. 3 The root does glue wounds together
and has the virtues of Britannica. 4 Drink one dram of the root with Wine
or Ale against the plague to expel it by sweat: so does the water or
decoction of the root. It helps also the bloody flixe, bruses, Iaundes, and
all venomous bytings. 5 The root with Piretrum of each like much, put into a
holow tooth with honey, cease the pain, and draws out the reume. 6 Wash the
kanker of the back, the polip of the nose, and all maligniant sores with the
water thereof to heal them. 7 The powder stops all bleeding and raw wounds.

Backkanker 6 Bytings venomous 4 Blood to stop 7 Bloodyflixe 1. 4 Bruses 4
Flowers to stop 1 Iaundes 4 Inflammations 2 Kanker 6 Mouth sores 2 Nose polip 6
Plague 4 Sores 2. 6 Teeth ache 5 lose 2. Throat sores 2 Vomiting 1 Wounds 3
Bitter sweet. (See Amaradulcis.)

Blessed thistle.
BLessed thistle: drink powder of the seeds for the pain and stitches in the
side, and all grypings in the body. 2 The powder eaten or drunk provoke
sweat, and helps headache, giddiness, and the memory, and restores
hearing. 3 The leaf, juice, seed, or water, heals all kinds of poison. 4
The water heals the kanker in the breast of a woman, though it be eaten to
the very ribs. Use it against the plague. 5 For the Fever Quarten and all other
Fevers, take one dram of the powder, or three ounces of the water distilled,
in May, a quarter of an hour before the fifth, and cover thee well to sweat. 6
The juice or powder helps headache. The juice quickens the sight. 7 The
powder stops blood at the nose. 8 The brooth taken with wine, causes
appetite. It is good for any ach in the body. 9 It strengthens the members of
the body. 10 It fasteneth lose teeth, and weak sinews. 11 It is good for the
dropsy. 12 It breaks the stone and impostumes. It preserves from the plague
being taken within xxiiii. hours before a man come into the infected place. 13
It it is good for the disinesse in the head, shortness of breath, and diseases
of the lungs, it strengthens the teeth, expels terms, provoke sleep,
and helps the falling evil and inward bruses. 14 The powder is good against
poison. 15 The same put into the guts by a Glister, helps the chollik, and
other griefs of the guts, and the wounds of the same. 16 The water or juice
helps the redness of the eyes, and the itch of them. 17 The leaves bruised
are good for the bytings of Serpents, burnings and Carbuncles, there is nothing
better for the Kanker and old festering sores. 18 The leaves are good for
fomentations and to be sitten over in water, that the vapor may come to the
diseased places, against the stone and stopping of the flowers. 19 Use it to
all headache, whirling, and giddiness, to cause a good memory, to comfort the
brain, to cleanse the breast, chest, stomach and throat, to provoke appetite, to
consume reume, and for pain in the belly, either the juice, water, powder,
seed or green herb. 20 The white Cotton heals all mortal wounds in three
days without pain or grief. 21 The herb or powder eaten, causes a sweet
breath, fasteneth the teeth, strengthens the gums, helps the matrix,
clears the heart. 22 If the nauill of little children fall out, boil the
herb in wine, and wash the nauill there with. 23 Blessed thistle, either eaten
or drunk, or eaten green with bread and butter as Sage and Parsely, or boiled
in pottage with other herbs, or the juice with wine or Ale and Sugar, or the
water of it by it self, or with wine, or Ale with Sugar, or the water by it
self, or with wine or Ale, or the powder of it used any ways before meat, or
with Sack after meat, or a good handful of it sodden in a quart of running
water to the one half, and then drunk with wine, or with Sugar or any other
ways used. 24 It strengthens all the inner parts of the body, sharpeneth the
wit, memory, and senses, comfort the stomach, causes appetite, resists
poison, and preserves from the plague. And is excellent against any kind of
Fever, if one dram of the powder be drunk with Ale or wine warm a quarter
of an hour before the fit, and the body well covered to sweat till the fit
be past, or the distilled water drunk after the same manner, and so it helps
against the plague and pestilent Fevers being taken within twelve hours after
the first taking of the grief. It opens the obstruction of the members, and
provoke urine. 25 The herb eaten, helps the pain of the lungs and head,
and causes good hearing, sharpeneth the wits and memory, and puts away
giddines. 26 It comfort the brain and the sight, both being eaten, and the
eyes anointed therewith: when the juice can not be had use the powder, or the
dried herb steeped in water, and wash therewith. Drop the juice into
bloodshotten eyes. Apply the herb to the bleeding of the nose or any other
place. 27 Eat the powder of the herb with honey to spet forth phlegm and
gross humors the more easily. 28 It helps a weak stomach, provoke
appetite, and softneth the heart, it consumes evil blood, and breeds good
blood. 29 The herb boiled in Wine causes sweat. 30 Boiled in water and
drunk, it consumes evil humors, and breeds good humors. 31 The herb
eaten, strengthens the palsy members, and heals blistred lungs. 32 The
herb boiled or drunk raw with Wine breaks the stone. 33 And boiled in the
urine of a healthful manchilde, and drunk, it helps the dropsy, and the
plague, and breaks all impostumes, and mastreth the Kanker and Falling
sickness. 34 The Down laid on cuts and new wounds, does heal them without
pain. 35 The herb chewed, cures a stinking breath. 36 Boil the herb in
Wine, and drink it a quarter of an hour before the fit, and cover thee well
to sweat, to help all Agues both hot and cold, or drink the powder with
hot Wine, or the distilled water for the same purpose, and so it helps
against any inward poison. 37 Eat or drink the powder of the herb, and
sweat three hours to help the stitch in the side. 38 The herb, powder or
juice drunk, helps the headache, and Megrem. 39 And taken in meat and
drink, it is good against disinesse swimming and giddiness of the head, and
is a singular remedy against deafness and provoke sleep. 40 The juice
laid to the eyes, quickens the sight, and so does the water or infusion of
the dry herb the eyes being washed therewith. 14 The water or juice dropped into
the eyes, cures their redness, bloodshooting and itch. The same rubbed on ye
teeth with a clout, fastneth them and strengthens them. 42 The powder
stancheth blood in the nose or else where. 43 The broth or decoction of the
herb in wine, helps an evil and weak stomach. 44 The powder eaten with
honey or drunk with wine, does ripen or digest cold phlegm, purges and
brings up that which is in the breast, and causes the breath to be easily
fetched, and the herb chewed, heals a stinking breath. 45 The powder taken
before infection, preserves from the plague. And one dram, or a
wallnutshelfull taken immediately after the infection, expels the venom of
the infection from the heart, so that a man sweat after it. 46 So does the
herb boiled in wine, or in the urine of a healthful manchild and drunk. 47
Drink the juice with wine against shortness of wind, the griefs of the
lungs, and for the consumption, or ptisik. 48 Eat the herb against the
trembling of the palsy members. Use the powder in Glisters against the chollik
and other griefs of the guts: Or drink the water or decoction to the same
effect, and for the green sickness, the griping and pain of the belly, to open
obstructions, to cause passage of the urine, to dissolve bruised blood and to
provoke sweat. 49 The leaves, juice, powder, or water heals the kanker, and
old rotten festered sores. The leaves stamped and applied, are good against
hot swellings, Carbuncles and sores that be hard to be cured, especially
plague sores, and also the bytings of venomous beasts, Serpents, and creeping
beasts. 50 The decoction of the herb kills worms, and takes away all
inward pain of the back and belly. 51 The herb either green or dry drunk
and applied, helps all grievous and swelling sores, bruses, bytings, etc. and
covers the flesh with skin, and is good in drinks for the French pocks, and
sores of the paps and teats, the powder being laid on them. For all inward
griefs it may be sodden in Ale or Wine, with Honey Lycoras or Sugar, or the
powder with bread and butter, or bread and honey, or lickt in with honey: the
seed may be sowed at any time of the year, and so it may be had at all times.
52 The water healed a woman that was eaten with a Kanker to the very ribs. 53
Stamp the herb and seethe it with Swines grease, wine, and wheat flower into
an ointment, and use it to all sores and ulcers, first washing them with white
wine, and then anointing them therewith twice a day. 54 Drink powder of the
seeds, to help the pain, pricking and stitches of the sides, belly, and
guts. 55 Stamp the green herb, and apply it to wounds to heal them speedily
and miraculously. 56 Drink the juice or powder to kill worms presently. 57
Steep the dried herb in Aqua vitae, and drink it against any grievous pain,
and be whole in short time. 58 Make a paste thereof with bread and honey, and
distill it with white wine, and it is most excellent for the sight. 59 Stamp
it grossly when it begins to flower, and steep it in common oil and Aqua
vitae with a little Frankincense, and let it remain till it be macerated, then
boil it and streine it, then take thereof a third part, and put thereto a
little Virgins wax, and boil it till it begin to fume and turn to black
color, then streine it, and keep it in a close glass, and drink one dram
of the oil with sweet Wine cold, to resolve any infirmity, and to preserve
health. And with the black humor anoint all the body when thou go to bed
cold, to resolve any evil quality, and to preserve good state. It
mainteineth the hair black that it wax not white. It kills worms in the
body with diverse other things not now written of. 60 The powder drunk in Wine
or taken in pills cutteth and drives down gross humors, helps the
griefs of the breast, purges the blood, and is good for the Pcisik. 61 The
leaves sodden in Wine and drunk hot, cease torment, provoke sweat and
the terms, and helps the plague, if it be taken within xxiiii. hours after
the first assault thereof: and also all rotten Fevers, the Quarten, and all
manner of poison, and the swelling that comes thereof, and so does the water
or powder. 62 The juice, tops, seeds, and leaves with Pepper and Wine stamped
together, is very good against all stingings of Serpents. 63 The bruised leaves
and the water, are good for burnings, Carbuncles, and bytings of Scorpions and
Serpents. 64 The leaves, juice, decoction or water, are good against the Kanker
and all other malignant sores and filthy ulcers. 65 The herb is good in
foments and bathes for the stone, and to drive down the flowers. It comfort
the brain, cleanses the breast, chest, and stomach and throat, provoke
appetite, consumes reume, and the pain in the belly. 66 The herb or powder
eaten, causes a sweet breath, fastneth teeth, strengthens the gums, helps
the matrix, and cheareth the heart, etc. For the Quarten, and all other Fevers,
cold, drink one dram of the powder with some of the water of the same
herb, and drink it with Aqua vitae to kill worms, and in short time to take
away all grievous pain of the body.
